nodes.bodyText: Is it never useful to read the encoding from entity.getContentEncoding()? Is the getCharset() call you replaced it with always preferable (or should there be a fallback mechanism)?
Never useful and not relevant. Content-Encoding specifies compression. In the case of your example, it will be gzip, but then get written to null when the request handler decompresses the content.
@tfmorris that's useful as a 1 line code comment there I would say. Disambiguating the Encoding term on the spot.
This conversation is about deleted code. That's why it's highlighted in red.
Oops, overlooked. Ok, well then not there
